What does dwelling coverage (Coverage A) protect on a homeowners policy?

Dwelling coverage (Coverage A) helps pay to repair or rebuild the structure of your home if it’s damaged by a covered peril, up to your policy limit. It generally includes the home’s attached structures, subject to exclusions and deductible.

What’s the difference between replacement cost and actual cash value for personal property?

Replacement cost pays to replace items with new, like kind and quality without subtracting depreciation (subject to policy conditions). Actual cash value typically pays replacement cost minus depreciation.

If my car is totaled, how is the payout determined?

A total loss payout is usually based on the vehicle’s actual cash value right before the loss, minus your deductible, plus applicable taxes/fees where allowed. If you have a loan or lease, gap coverage (if purchased) may help with any remaining balance.

What information do you need to start an auto claim?

We typically need the date/time, location, description of what happened, driver/vehicle details, photos if available, police report number (if applicable), and contact/insurance information for other parties. We’ll then assign a claim number and next steps.

How do I add a lienholder to my auto policy?
Provide the lienholder’s name, mailing address, and loan/lease account number. We’ll update your policy records and, if requested, send proof of coverage to the lienholder.

What is an umbrella policy and when does it apply?

An umbrella policy provides extra liability protection above your underlying auto/home limits. It can apply when a covered liability claim exceeds your base policy limits, subject to exclusions and required underlying coverage levels.

Can I change my billing due date?
Often yes, depending on product and state rules. We can review available draft dates and update your billing schedule; changes may take effect on your next billing cycle.

What does “medical payments” coverage do on auto insurance?

Medical Payments (MedPay) can help pay medical expenses for you and your passengers after an auto accident, regardless of fault, up to the selected limit. Availability and covered expenses vary by state and policy terms.

How do Roth IRA withdrawals work?

Roth IRA contributions can generally be withdrawn tax- and penalty-free at any time. Earnings may be tax-free if the withdrawal is qualified (e.g., account open at least five years and age 59½ or another qualifying event), per IRS rules.

What is the purpose of a beneficiary designation?

A beneficiary designation specifies who receives the proceeds of a life insurance policy (or certain financial accounts) upon the owner/insured’s death. Keeping it up to date helps ensure benefits are paid according to your current wishes.
